bibl.title: A New Fragment of Sophocles' Tereus.
bibl.note: Versions of this paper were delivered at St Petersburg (at the Bibliotheca Classica), Nottingham (at the conference 'Fragmented Women; the Female Characters of Fragmentary Greek Tragedy'), Melbourne, Canberra, Sydney, Perth, Athens (at the Academy), and Oxford (at All Souls College). - 1. Introduction. - 2. Text [P. Oxy. LXXXII, 5292 (= LDAB 702421)]. - 3. Initial Deductions. - 4. What does Procne know? - 5. The Shepherd's news. - 6. Philomela confined? - 7. The Tereus hypothesis [P. Oxy. XLII, 3013 (= M.-P.3 1480.2; LDAB 3938)]. - 8. Procne's tragedy. - 9. Trachiniae, Medea, Iphigenia in Tauris. - 10. Conclusion. - Pp. 81-82: 11. Appendix: W.B. Henry's exempli gratia reconstruction.
bibl.seg: Patrick J. Finglass, A New Fragment of Sophocles' Tereus.

Versions of this paper were delivered at St Petersburg (at the Bibliotheca Classica), Nottingham (at the conference 'Fragmented Women; the Female Characters of Fragmentary Greek Tragedy'), Melbourne, Canberra, Sydney, Perth, Athens (at the Academy), and Oxford (at All Souls College). - 1. Introduction. - 2. Text [P. Oxy. LXXXII, 5292 (= LDAB 702421)]. - 3. Initial Deductions. - 4. What does Procne know? - 5. The Shepherd's news. - 6. Philomela confined? - 7. The Tereus hypothesis [P. Oxy. XLII, 3013 (= M.-P.3 1480.2; LDAB 3938)]. - 8. Procne's tragedy. - 9. Trachiniae, Medea, Iphigenia in Tauris. - 10. Conclusion. - Pp. 81-82: 11. Appendix: W.B. Henry's exempli gratia reconstruction.
